title.narrative: NATIONAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) CAPACITY AND POLICY

description.narrative: Strengthening national capacity to provide sustainable access to drinking water and adequate sanitation, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid), Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children under 5 have access and use equitable public and community facilities for the prevention and treatment of malnutrition, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthening national capacity to provide sustainable access to drinking water and adequate sanitation

description.narrative: To contribute to national capacity building, UNICEF supported the General Directorate of Energy, Mines and Water (DGME) to set up a system for assessing the state of water resources on a georeferenced medium which will allow to sound the alarm and to mitigate the disastrous impacts of possible negative events. Through advocacy, UNICEF has succeeded in integrating sanitation into the mandates of the DGME, which now monitors its progress. Thus, with the technical and financial support of UNICEF, training courses on manufacturing techniques for improved toilets respecting the standards were organized for local artisans on the three islands. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
